intro: Malleostemon uniflorus, commonly known as the single-flower malleostemon, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds, and it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
